system.description: Every creature is considered to have all basic abilities by default. However, some basic abilities may have additional requirements that must be met in order to actually be used.

overview.base: You use the MP in a mana storing to pay 1 or more of the MP for the ability.

system.requirements: The invoked item must be mana storing and have more than 0 stored MP.
system.trigger: You are spending MP on some ability.

overview.base: You try to help the triggering creature with the task, this typically grants the creature advantage with whatever they were attempting, but the GM may rule otherwise.

system.requirements: You have already use Prepare Aid on the triggering creature or the GM rules that this is unnecessary.
system.trigger: Another creature is about to use an action that requires a tradecraft check, attack roll, or some other check.

overview.base: You attempt a tradecraft check. The GM chooses which tradecraft and what the DC is. They may also specify who should or shouldn't have knowledge of the result of the [[/roll d20]] roll.

results.save: Results are determined by the GM.
results.fail: Results are determined by the GM.

overview.base: You attempt to become hidden. As you do this, you roll [[/roll 1d20 + @snk]]. If this is greater than the passive perception ([[/roll 10 + @per]]) of any creatures that could see you, you become hidden from them. The value you rolled is your hidden DC.
overview.proficient: Instead roll [[/roll 1d20 + @snk + @p]] for your hidden DC.
overview.fluent: Instead roll [[/roll 1d20 + @snk + @f]] for your hidden DC.

system.requirements: You are in a location with shadows, dim light, three-quarters cover, or some other feature which the GM determines is appropriate for being hidden. You must remain in areas that maintain these conditions to stay hidden.

overview.base: You take control over something that requires presence, becoming attuned to it.

system.requirements: You are using target item or mounted on target creature.

overview.base: Note: There are many Abilities, Item Properties, and other effects that alter the amount or type of damage your weapon may deal. These typically apply to this and other attack abilities.

results.hit: Deal standard damage.

results.save: The attack's effect fizzles.

overview.base: You issue a command to a minion that is under your control. It gains 2 actions that it can use before the end of your turn. If you somehow used Basic Command as a free action instead of a single action, then the minion gains only 1 actions instead.

system.requirements: You have a minion under your control.

results.save: The attack's effect fizzles.
results.fail: The attack's effect applies.

system.trigger: Another creature within range is being attacked.

results.save: The cone's effect fizzles.
results.fail: The cone's effect applies.

system.requirements: The item you're using Block Cone with has the blocking property. The ability targeting you is a cone.
system.trigger: A cone would target you.

overview.base: Target is burned.

system.requirements: Delivery item must be burning.

overview.base: You catch the item. If multiple creatures are all trying to catch the same item, they all roll [[/roll 1d20 + @p]]. The creature with the highest roll catches the item.

system.trigger: An item within range is falling or flying by.

results.save: You detect that the target is not disguised, regardless of whether or not they actually are. This also applies if Check Disguise is resisted or fizzles for some other reason.
results.fail: You detect whether or not the target is disguised, but you can't determine the true form of the target.

overview.base: You release control over something you were attuned to that requires presence, freeing yourself to control something else in the process.

Rather than acting now, you delay until a later time. The rest of your turn doesn't happen yet. Instead, you're removed from the initiative order. You can return to the initiative order at the end of any other creature's turn. This permanently changes your initiative to the new position. You can't use any reaction abilities until you return to the initiative order. If you Delay for an entire round without returning to the initiative order, the actions from the delayed turn are lost, your initiative order doesn't change, and your next turn occurs at your original position in the initiative order.

When you use Delay, any negative effects that normally occur at the start or end of your turn occur immediately when you use the delayed action. Any benificial effects that would end at any point during your turn also end. The GM might determine that other effects end when you use Delay as well. Essentially, you can't Delay to avoid negative consequences that would happen on your turn or to extend beneficial effects that would end on your turn.

Instead of the target making the feat save, you do. The DC of the Disbelieve is determined by the type of illusion are you targeting. If you resist or are immune to mental effects, then you are fluent in Disbelieve.
overview.fluent: You are adept at Disbelieve.

system.heightened: For each additional MP spent, the DC of the Disbelieve decreases by 2.

overview.base: Your movement does not trigger Opportunity Attack.
You fall prone.
Make a DC 10 herbalist check.

results.hit: If the target was minorly transformed, they revert to their original form.

overview.base: You use your hand or hands to manipulate an object or the terrain. You can grab an unattended or stored object, draw a weapon, swap a held item for another, open a door, or achieve a similar effect. On rare occasions, the GM may request some sort of check or dice roll to see if your Interaction was successful.
Note: There are many Abilities, Item Properties, and other effects that alter the amount or type of damage your weapon may deal. These typically apply to this and other attack abilities.

results.hit: Deal standard damage.

system.requirements: This attack must be melee.

overview.base: At the end of your next turn, if nobody within your duel has targeted another creature within the duel (or equipment they bear) with an ability, then the duel ends. You count as "losing" and return to the Material Realm. Any of your opponents count as "winning".
You are melee dodging until the start of your next turn.

system.requirements: You are not prone, snared, or immobile.

overview.base: You are missile dodging until the start of your next turn.

system.requirements: You are not prone, snared, or immobile.

overview.base: You move on a distance up to your movement speed on the ground. If you have a fly speed or swim speed then you may move in the air or in water accordingly. The same applies for other types of movement as well.
You may make a single action weapon or hand attack against the triggering creature.

system.trigger: A creature moves outside of your reach.

overview.base: If the target is "indebted", this pays off an amount of their debt equal to the amount paid upon using Pay Gold.

value.variable: An amount of gold of your choosing.

overview.base: The MP is spent into the target. Any effects are determined by the GM.

value.variable: An amount of MP of your choosing.

overview.base: Roll [[/roll 1d20 + @per]]. You see any hidden creatures with a "Hidden DC" less than or equal to your roll.

system.range: As Far As You Can See

overview.base: You prepare to help the target creature with something that requires a tradecraft check, attack roll, or some other check. You are now able to use Aid when they make the check. The GM may rule that this takes additional time or add other stipulations.

results.hit: If the target is an item, you know if it is magical or not. If it is a creature, then you know if they have any sustained magical abilities currently active on them or if they themselves are intrinsically magical in some way.

overview.base:
You prepare to use an action that will occur outside your turn. Choose a single action or free action ability you can use, and designate a trigger. Your turn then ends. If the trigger you designated occurs before the start of your next turn, you can use the chosen ability as a reaction (provided you still meet the requirements to use it).

If you have an attack penalty from making multiple attacks and your readied ability is an attack ability, your readied ability takes the same attack penalty you had at the time you used Ready. This is one of the few times the attack penalty applies when it's not your turn.

You can spend one or more hit dice at the end of a short rest, up to the creature's total number of hit dice. For each hit die spent in this way, the creature regains that many HP as well as an additional P HP. A creature regains all spent hit dice when it finishes a long rest.
Target is reloaded.

system.requirements: Target has the loading property.

overview.base: You all take one type of searchable item from target.
Instead of your normal feat save DC, the DC of Self Revert is determined by the type of transformation.

results.hit: Target is immobilized.

system.endCondition: At the end of each of your turns, they roll [[/roll 2d4]]. If either of these dice roll a 4, this effect ends.
system.requirements: Snag can only be made with a snagging item.

overview.base: You are no longer prone.

Either start or continue some slow ability that has an Execution Time that's well defined in one of the following units.
  • Seconds
  • Minutes
  • Hours
  • Days
  • Weeks
  • Months
  • Years
Note: If you do not use Sustain at least once per turn, then the slow ability fizzles. You will have to restart it.
You can treat a type of hack damage you've taken as though it is one step lower.

system.endCondition: The turn ends.

overview.base: You may make a single action weapon or hand attack against the triggering creature using a different weapon or hand than the triggering attack.

system.requirements: You have a second weapon or hand that is capable of making an attack and that did not make the triggering attack.
system.trigger: You have just made an attack against a creature other than yourself.
